column4: I'm installing ubuntu in virtual box and I assigned the VM 2GB of ram. how much swap space do i really need ?
do i need more than 1 GB of swap
you prob wont even _need_ swap, but use whatever
for general use ubuntu should use anywhere near the full 2gb, but swap wont hurt, give it 512mb or whatever space you can afford
the VM has a total of 12GB
well give it 2gb  just for the sake of it
i don't want to worry about running out of space later on ..
10gb youll be able to install quite a lot on
youll probably get used to it and end up install it proper anyway :)
i know it doesn't matter but as a general practice, is it a good idea to have root as hda1 and swap hda2 or vice versa
put root on 1 just to be neat lol
if it were me, id just give ubuntu 1 big / partition and sue that
i wouldnt bother with swap. i run every one of my vms with 2gb ram no swap
